summary:
On April 15, 1989, a football match in Sheffield, England, turned deadly. At Hillsborough Stadium, too many fans were let into a small area, causing a deadly crush. 97 people died, making it the worst sports disaster in British history.

Police blamed fans at first, but later reports showed police and stadium design were at fault. The disaster led to big changes in stadium safety, like removing standing areas. Inquests ruled the fans were unlawfully killed due to police and ambulance service mistakes. Several people were charged for their roles in the tragedy.
title: Hillsborough disaster
